column3: What is your current level of education?
column5: What is your current self-assessed disability status?

column11: I instill pride in others for being associated with me
column12: I go beyond self-interest for the good of the group
column13: I act in ways that build others’ respect for me
column14: I display a sense of power and confidence
column15: I talk about my most important values and beliefs
column16: I specify the importance of having a strong sense of purpose
column17: I consider the moral and ethical consequences of decisions
column18: I emphasize the importance of having a collective sense of mission
column19: I talk optimistically about the future
column20: I talk enthusiastically about what needs to be accomplished
column21: I articulate a compelling vision of the future
column22: I express confidence that goals will be achieved
column23: I re-examine critical assumptions to question whether they are appropriate
column24: I seek differing perspectives when solving problems
column25: I get others to look at problems from many different angles
column26: I suggest new ways of looking at how to complete assignments
column27: I spend time teaching and coaching
column28: I treat others as individuals rather than just as a member of a group
column29: I consider an individual as having different needs, abilities, and aspirations from others
column30: I help others to develop their strengths
column31: I feel I am being paid a fair amount for the work I do
column32: There is really too little chance for promotion on my job
column33: My supervisor is quite competent in doing his/her job
column34: I am not satisfied with the benefits I receive
column35: When I do a good job, I receive the recognition for it that I should receive
column36: Many of our rules and procedures make doing a good job difficult
column37: I like the people I work with
column38: I sometimes feel my job is meaningless
column39: Communications seem good within this organization
column40: Raises are too few and far between
column41: Those who do well on the job stand a fair chance of being promoted
column42: My supervisor is unfair to me
column43: The benefits we receive are as good as most other organizations offer
column44: I do not feel that the work I do is appreciated
column45: My efforts to do a good job are seldom blocked by red tape
column46: I find I have to work harder at my job because of the incompetence of people I work with
column47: I like doing the things I do at work
column48: The goals of this organization are not clear to me
column49: I often seriously consider leaving my current job
column50: I intend to quit my current job
column51: I have started to look for other jobs
column52: How often have you seriously considered leaving your current job?
column53: How often have you done each of the following things on your present job?
column54: Took time to advise, coach, or mentor a co-worker
column55: Helped co-worker learn new skills or shared job knowledge
column56: Helped new employees get oriented to the job
column57: Lent a compassionate ear when someone had a work problem
column58: Lent a compassionate ear when someone had a personal problem
column59: Changed vacation schedule, work days, or shifts to accommodate co-worker’s needs
column60: Offered suggestions to improve how work is done
column61: Offered suggestions for improving the work environment
column62: Finished something for co-worker who had to leave early
column63: Helped a less capable co-worker lift a heavy box or other object
column64: Helped a co-worker who had too much to do
column66: Took phone messages for absent or busy co-worker
column67: Said good things about your employer in front of others
column68: Gave up meal and other breaks to complete work
column69: Volunteered to help a co-worker deal with a difficult customer, vendor, or co-worker
column70: Went out of the way to give co-worker encouragement or express appreciation
column71: Decorated, straightened up, or otherwise beautified common work space
column72: Defended a co-worker who was being "put-down" or spoken ill of by other co-workers or supervisor
column73: I think about migrating to another country temporarily
column74: I think about migrating to another country permanently
column75: I seek information about opportunities available for me outside this country
column76: I apply for opportunities outside this country
column77: I express my desire to others about wanting to pursue opportunities outside this country
column78: I am approached about potential opportunities outside this country
column79: If you migrated to another country, how likely do you believe you would have better career development and fulfillment prospects?
column80: If you migrated to another country, how likely do you believe that you would have better income and financial wellness prospects?
column81: If you migrated to another country, how likely do you believe you would have better family life prospects?
column82: If you migrated to another country, how likely do you believe you would have better social life prospects?
column83: How likely do you believe your current university education and/or any upcoming degree will enable you to migrate to another country successfully?
column84: How much thought have you given to abandoning your job here to migrate outside the country?
column85: Given your experience working in this university compared with what your experience could be elsewhere, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column86: Given the inspiration received so far from your current level of interaction with other academic staff at this university, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column87: Given the consequences and outcomes so far from your current level of interaction with your supervisors and leaders at this University, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column88: Given the volume and complexity of working in your discipline at this University compared with what your experience could potentially be elsewhere, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column89: When you consider the knowledge and awareness you have acquired from social media, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column90: When you consider the influence and expectations of family and significant others, how likely is it that you would migrate outside the country in the next 1-3 years?
column91: Did you intentionally select your current academic discipline to prepare you for potential migration to another country?
column92: Would you invest time and resources in additional education at this University beyond your current degree to improve your prospects for successfully migrating to another country?
column93: Would you invest time and resources in additional education at another in-country University beyond your current degree to improve your prospects for successfully migrating to another country?
column94: Have you traveled outside this country before?
column95: When you consider your prior international travel, how likely is it that you would migrate outside this country in the next 1-3 years?
column96: How likely will your knowledge of the experience of those who successfully migrated outside this country influence a decision by you to migrate in the next 1-3 years?
column97: How likely will your knowledge of the experience of those who successfully migrated outside their own countries influence a decision by you to migrate in the next 1-3 years?
column98: Obtaining relevant information about migrant arrival, onboarding and welfare at the destination country
column99: Securing academic opportunities at destination country
column100: Securing job opportunities at destination country
column104: Securing savings and funding for travel to, and stay at intended destination
column105: Informing significant others (e.g. spouse, parents, clergy, close friends) based outside the country about migration intentions
column106: Informing significant others (e.g. spouse, parents, clergy, close friends) based in-country about migration intentions
